text: Jordanita kurdica is a moth of the family Zygaenidae. It is known from south- eastern Turkey and western Iran. The length of the forewings is 15.5–17 mm for males and about 11.5 mm for females. Adults are on wing from June to July. ==References== *C. M. Naumann, W. G. Tremewan: The Western Palaearctic Zygaenidae. Apollo Books, Stenstrup 1999, ==External links== *Barcode of Life Data Systems (Bold) Category:Procridinae Category:Moths described in 1987 Category:Flora of Kurdistan
title: Jordanita kurdica
